SEARCH
Package interfaces

Interface IEnquiryManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
EnquiryManager
public interface IEnquiryManager
The IEnquiryManager interface defines the contract for managing enquiries about BTO projects.

This interface specifies the operations required for:

  • Creating and retrieving enquiries
  • Updating and deleting enquiries
  • Replying to enquiries
  • Filtering enquiries by project or user
  • Persisting enquiry data

  • Method Details

    • getEnquiriesForProject

      List<Enquiry> getEnquiriesForProject(String projectName)
      Gets all enquiries for a specific BTO project.
      Parameters:
      projectName - The name of the project to get enquiries for
      Returns:
      A list of enquiries for the specified project

    • getEnquiriesForUser

      List<Enquiry> getEnquiriesForUser(String nric)
      Gets all enquiries submitted by a specific user.
      Parameters:
      nric - The NRIC of the user to get enquiries for
      Returns:
      A list of enquiries submitted by the specified user

    • getEnquiry

      Enquiry getEnquiry(String id)
      Gets an enquiry by its unique identifier.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the enquiry to find
      Returns:
      The enquiry if found, null otherwise

    • createEnquiry

      Enquiry createEnquiry(User creator, BTOProject project, String content)
      Creates a new enquiry about a BTO project.
      Parameters:
      creator - The user creating the enquiry
      project - The project the enquiry is about
      content - The content of the enquiry
      Returns:
      The newly created enquiry

    • updateEnquiry

      boolean updateEnquiry(String id, String content, User user)
      Updates the content of an existing enquiry.

      Only the creator of an enquiry can update it, and only if it has not been replied to.

      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the enquiry to update
      content - The new content for the enquiry
      user - The user attempting to update the enquiry
      Returns:
      true if the enquiry was successfully updated, false otherwise

    • deleteEnquiry

      boolean deleteEnquiry(String id, User user)
      Deletes an enquiry from the system.

      Only the creator of an enquiry can delete it, and only if it has not been replied to.

      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the enquiry to delete
      user - The user attempting to delete the enquiry
      Returns:
      true if the enquiry was successfully deleted, false otherwise

    • addReply

      boolean addReply(String id, String reply, User user)
      Adds a reply to an enquiry.

      Only HDB Officers and Managers can reply to enquiries.

      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the enquiry to reply to
      reply - The reply content
      user - The user adding the reply
      Returns:
      true if the reply was successfully added, false otherwise

    • replyToEnquiry

      boolean replyToEnquiry(String enquiryId, String reply, HDBManager manager)
      Allows an HDB Manager to reply to an enquiry about a project they manage.

      This is a specialized version of addReply that checks if the manager is responsible for the project the enquiry is about.

      Parameters:
      enquiryId - The unique identifier of the enquiry to reply to
      reply - The reply content
      manager - The HDB Manager adding the reply
      Returns:
      true if the reply was successfully added, false otherwise

    • saveEnquiries

      void saveEnquiries()
      Saves all enquiry data to persistent storage.
